THIS MOBILE NUMBERS SUPPLY AGREEMENT applies when using the British Numbers API.

BETWEEN:

BONA FIDES SOLUTIONS LTD, a company incorporated in England and Wales (registered no. 11958241), and whose registered office is at 32 Airco Close, London, NW9 0NW (“BFS”); and
the API User (“Customer”).

BACKGROUND

A) BFS is engaged in the business of providing mobile telecommunications services to businesses and consumers and has access to allocated ranges of mobile telephone numbers by Ofcom.
B) The terms and conditions of this Agreement shall apply to any supply of mobile numbers from BFS to Customer.

1 DEFINITIONS

1.1 ‘Agreement’
means these terms and conditions.
1.2 ‘Business Day’
means a day other than a Saturday, Sunday or bank holiday in the United Kingdom.
1.3 ‘Charges’
means the charges payable by Customer for the Golden Numbers as set by BFS, on a price list provided by BFS, or otherwise as confirmed to the Customer in writing.
1.4 ‘Change of Control’
means a change in the entity which Controls a party.
1.5 ‘Commencement Date’
means the latest date of this Agreement.
1.6 ‘Confidential Information’
means the terms of this Agreement, secret or confidential commercial, financial, marketing, technical, know-how, trade secrets and other information relating to BFS or the Customer, in any form or medium whether disclosed orally or in writing before, during or after the date of this Agreement, together with any reproductions of such information in any form or medium or any part of this information.
1.7 ‘Control’ or ‘Controlled’
means in relation to a company, that a company shall be treated as “controlled” by another if that other company (whether directly or indirectly and whether by ownership of share capital, possession of voting power, contract or otherwise) appoints (or is able to appoint) and/or removes (or is able to remove) the majority of the members of the governing body of that company or otherwise controls or has the power to control the affairs and policies of that company.
1.8 ‘Disclosing Party’
means the party to this Agreement disclosing Confidential Information.
1.9 ‘End User’
means an individual to whom the Customer re-supplies the USIM or Golden Number.
1.10 ‘Golden Numbers’
means the specified telephone numbers made available to Customer by BFS from time to time.
1.11 ‘BFS Affiliate’
means (i) any person which from time to time is Controlled directly or indirectly by BFS; (ii) any company in which BFS holds directly or indirectly 50% or more of the shares or voting power, or (iii) BFS.
1.12 ‘Customer Terms’
means UK network providers’ standard Pay As You Go (pre-pay) customer terms and conditions or any subsequent contract terms an End User enters into with a UK network provider.
1.13 ‘BFS Marks’
means the service marks, trademarks, logos, related brands, and other distinctive brand features of BFS as owned by or licensed to BFS from time to time.
1.14 ‘UK Network’
means the UK mobile network used by BFS from time to time.
1.15 ‘Intellectual Property Rights’
means all intellectual property rights, including without limitation, patents, registered designs, trademarks and services marks (whether registered or not), rights in the nature of unfair competition rights, copyright, database rights, design rights, and all similar property rights including those subsisting (in any part of the world) in inventions, designs, drawings, performances, computer programs, semi-conductor topographies, confidential information, business names, goodwill and the style and presentation of goods or services and applications and the right to apply for protection of any of the above rights.
1.16 ‘Insolvency Event’
means when a person is unable to pay its debts (within the meaning of section 123(1) of the Insolvency Act 1986) or an order is made or a resolution passed for its liquidation, winding-up or dissolution (otherwise than for the purposes of a solvent amalgamation or reconstruction) or an administrative or other receiver, manager, trustee, liquidator, administrator or similar officer is appointed over it or all or any substantial part of its assets or takes formal steps towards making any kind of composition, compromise or arrangement involving it and any of its creditors, or anything analogous to the foregoing will occur in any jurisdiction.
1.17 ‘Ofcom’
means the Office of Communications established pursuant to the Communications Act 2003.
1.18 ‘Order’
means written confirmation from the Customer of the Golden Numbers it wishes to obtain, having been notified of the Charges, and subject to acceptance by BFS.
1.19 ‘Payment Due Date’
shall have the meaning given to it in Clause 5.
1.20 ‘Port’ or ‘Porting’
means the process of transferring a mobile telephone number from BFS to an alternative telecommunications network services provider.
1.21 ‘Receiving Party’
means the party to this Agreement to whom Confidential Information is disclosed.
1.22 ‘USIM(s)’
means a UK Universal Subscriber Identification Module card programmed with a Golden Number, as listed in Schedule 1 or identified in an Order, which enables access to network services subject to the network providers’ Customer Terms.
1.23
In the Interpretation of this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires:
1.23.1 headings are for reference only and do not affect its meaning;
1.23.2 references to clauses or schedules are to clauses of and the schedules to this Agreement;
1.23.3 the singular shall include the plural and vice versa;
1.23.4 references to a ‘person’ include any person, firm, company, corporation, government, state or agency of a state or any association, trust or partnership; and
1.23.5 any reference to any statute or legislation shall be deemed to include any amendments, re-enactments or replacements unless otherwise stated.

2 SCOPE AND APPLICATION OF TERMS

2.1 The terms and conditions set out in this Agreement are the only conditions upon which BFS is prepared to deal with the Customer in respect of the supply of Golden Numbers and they shall govern the Agreement and any Order issued under this Agreement to the entire exclusion of all other terms or conditions, including but not limited to any conflicting terms on any Order document.
2.2 This Agreement does not create an exclusive relationship between BFS and the Customer. BFS is free to supply to any third-party Golden Numbers or associated services that are the same or are substantially the same as those described in this Agreement.
2.3 BFS does not guarantee that any particular Golden Numbers, or any minimum volume of Golden Numbers, will be available for supply to the Customer.

3 CONDITIONS OF SUPPLY AND USE

3.1 USIMs are supplied on a UK Network, and the use of USIMs and the Golden Numbers while they remain linked to a UK Network provider is subject to the network providers’ Customer Terms in addition to the terms of this Agreement.
3.2 Customer shall only provide Golden Numbers to individual End Users and shall not provide Golden Numbers to any operator of network services or telecommunications networks. However, Customer may obtain a PAC code from BFS or Port Golden Numbers on behalf of an End-User.
3.3 BFS shall not be liable for any cancellation, expiry or re-patriation of a Golden Number arising as a result of (i) the action or inaction of the Customer or End User, where the USIM is linked to a UK Network provider and where in accordance with the network providers’ Customer Terms; (ii) for any reason outside BFS’s reasonable control; or (iii) following the Porting of a Golden Number to a third party mobile telecommunications network.

4 ORDERS, DELIVERY, RISK AND TITLE

4.1 The Customer shall pay the Charges in advance of delivery of the USIMs or PACs in accordance with Clause 5.
4.2 BFS will deliver the USIMs or PACs to the UK business premises or email of the Customer within 10 working days of receiving cleared payment of the Charges (in the case of mainland UK), or otherwise within a reasonable time.
4.3 BFS may add a reasonable delivery charge to any Order.

5 CHARGES AND PAYMENT

5.1 Customer shall pay all Charges (without any deduction or set-off) within seven (7) days of the date of BFS's invoice (the ‘Payment Due Date’).
5.2 The Charges are inclusive of VAT which shall be paid by Customer at the prevailing rate.
5.3 If BFS has not received payment of the Charges by the Payment Due Date, and the Customer fails to remedy its failure to pay the Charges within fourteen days of receipt in writing of a notice from BFS requiring the Customer to pay the outstanding Charges, BFS shall be entitled, at its sole discretion, to (i) terminate the Order to which the outstanding Charges relate or (ii) in the event that the USIMs have been supplied to the Customer prior to payment of the Charges, require the return of the USIMs or provision of valid PACs by the Customer, and cancel or re-allocate the Golden Numbers to which the outstanding Charges relate.

6 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

6.1 All Intellectual Property Rights in the BFS Marks and the Confidential Information of BFS shall remain the absolute property of BFS and/or its third-party licensors.
6.2 Nothing in this Agreement shall permit Customer to use the BFS Marks without BFS’s prior written consent, and any such consent shall be subject to the Customer’s compliance with any brand guidelines or further instructions provided by BFS from time to time.
6.3 Customer undertakes not to do any act which may jeopardise, limit, interfere with or in any way infringe BFS’s Intellectual Property Rights, goodwill, or reputation.

7 TERM AND TERMINATION

7.1 This Agreement shall come into force on the Commencement Date and shall remain in force unless terminated in accordance with this Clause 7.
7.2 Either Party may terminate this Agreement on giving not less than 30 days’ written notice to the other.
7.3 Either party may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect by giving written notice to the other if:
7.3.1 the other is in material breach of its obligations under this Agreement and either such breach is incapable of remedy, or the breach continues unremedied for 30 days after receiving written notice requiring it to remedy such breach;
7.3.2 the other suffers an Insolvency Event;
7.3.3 termination is permitted under Clause 11 (Force Majeure); or
7.3.4 if any licence, permission or authorisation necessary for the supply of the USIMs, PACs and Golden Numbers by BFS is revoked.
7.4 BFS may additionally terminate this Agreement or any outstanding Order with immediate effect by giving written notice to Customer if the Customer:
7.4.1 breaches Clause 3.2 of this Agreement;
7.4.2 undergoes a Change of Control or sells or transfers a substantial part of its assets to any third party which has not been approved by BFS;
7.4.3 without reasonable cause, fails to return the USIMs, or provide valid PACs, within 14 days of receiving a request from BFS following termination of this Agreement; or
7.4.4 changes its trading name without prior written consent from BFS.

8 CONSEQUENCES OF TERMINATION

8.1 On termination of this Agreement for any reason:
8.1.1 the Customer shall cease using the BFS Marks immediately;
8.1.2 the Customer shall cease selling and distributing the Golden Numbers and the USIMs immediately;
8.1.3 the Customer shall pay to BFS all Charges due and owing under this Agreement (whether or not invoiced at the date of termination); and
8.1.4 the Customer shall return to BFS all USIMs (unused) within 14 days of termination of this Agreement.

9 CONFIDENTIALITY

9.1 Each party agrees not to use the Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose other than the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, and not to disclose the Confidential Information of the other party to any third party without the other party’s prior written consent.
9.2 The obligations of confidentiality set out in this Clause 9 shall not apply to any information which (i) is or becomes public knowledge other than by breach of this Agreement; (ii) is in the possession of the receiving party without restriction in relation to disclosure before the date of receipt from the disclosing party; (iii) is received from a third party who lawfully acquired it and who is under no obligation restricting its disclosure; or (iv) is independently developed without access to the Confidential Information of the disclosing party.

10 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

10.1 Nothing in this Agreement shall limit or exclude BFS’s liability for:
10.1.1 death or personal injury caused by its negligence, or the negligence of its employees, agents or subcontractors;
10.1.2 fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; or
10.1.3 any matter in respect of which it would be unlawful for BFS to exclude or restrict liability.

11 FORCE MAJEURE

11.1 Neither party shall be liable for failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement if, and only to the extent that, such failure is not caused by and the effects are beyond the reasonable control of the affected party, including because of any act of God, fire, flood, lightning, war, revolution, act of terrorism, riot or civil commotion.
11.2 If the event that the force majeure event described above continues for longer than 30 days then the unaffected Party may at the expiry of such 30-day period, provided the event is still subsisting, give notice in writing to the affected Party terminating this Agreement with immediate effect.

12 ENTIRE AGREEMENT

This Agreement sets out the entire agreement and understanding between BFS and Customer with respect to its subject matter. All other terms, express or implied by statute or otherwise, are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law.

13 VARIATIONS

BFS may introduce variations to this Agreement on 30 days’ notice to the Customer. No variation to this Agreement shall take effect unless agreed by both parties in writing.

14 PUBLICITY

The Customer shall not disclose in its publicity material or otherwise the existence of this Agreement or the terms of its relationship with BFS without the prior written consent of BFS.

15 ASSIGNMENT

The Customer shall not sub-contract or assign its obligations under this Agreement to any third party without BFS's prior written consent.

16 WAIVER

16.1 No waiver of any of the terms of this Agreement shall be valid unless in writing and signed by or on behalf of BFS and Customer.
16.2 No failure or delay by a party to exercise any right or remedy provided under this Agreement or by law shall constitute a waiver of that or any other right or remedy, nor shall it prevent or restrict the further exercise of that or any other right or remedy.

17 CONTRACT (RIGHTS OF THIRD PARTIES) ACT 1999

A person who is not a party to this Agreement or a permitted assignee has no rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 to enforce any term of this Agreement.

18 SEVERABILITY

The invalidity or unenforceability of any provision (or any part thereof) of this Agreement shall not affect the validity or enforceability of the remainder of this Agreement.

19 NOTICES

19.1 Any notice or other communication to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and signed by or on behalf of the Party giving it and may be served by leaving it, delivering it by hand or sending it by first class post to the address and for the attention of the relevant Party set out in Clause 20.2 (or as otherwise notified from time to time under this Agreement). Any notice so served by hand, fax or post shall be deemed to have been received:
19.1.1 in the case of delivery by hand, when delivered;
19.1.2 in the case of post, at the expiry of two (2) Business Days (or in the case of air mail which must be sent by a guaranteed delivery method ten (10) Business Days) after the envelope containing the same was delivered into the custody of the postal authorities;
19.1.3 provided that where, in the case of delivery by hand or by fax, such delivery or transmission occurs after 6 p.m. on a Business Day or on a day which is not a Business Day, service shall be deemed to occur at 9 a.m. on the next following Business Day.

20 PARTNERSHIP

Each of BFS and Customer are independent contractors. Nothing in this Agreement shall render BFS or Customer an agent of the other, and neither party shall hold itself out as an agent of the other.

21 SURVIVAL

Any provision of this Agreement which expressly or by implication is intended to come into or remain in force on or after termination shall continue in full force and effect notwithstanding any such termination.

22 APPLICABLE LAW

The construction, validity and performance of this Agreement and any dispute relating to its subject matter shall be governed by the laws of England and Wales and BFS and Customer hereby submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England.
